definition: road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)

sentences.english: When you first start learning to drive a stick shift car, don't do it on any kind of a hill.
sentences.chinese: 当您刚开始学习驾驶手动挡时，千万别尝试任何坡道。

sentences.english: Don't take foolish liberties on the ski slopes.
sentences.chinese: 不要在滑雪坡道上作愚蠢地冒险。

sentences.english: The cable car 's first run started at the top of a307- foot hill.
sentences.chinese: 缆车一开始是从307尺高的坡道上往下行驶。

sentences.english: The longest ski slope in Dalarna.
As she looked ahead down the long ramp leading to the guard's gate, her heart sank.
sentences.chinese: 低头看着前面通往安检门的坡道，她的心沉了下去。

sentences.english: Try pressure ramp at beginning of sleep period.
sentences.chinese: 尝试压力坡道开始睡眠期。

sentences.english: There are few sidewalks, and no ramps, no rails.
sentences.chinese: 这里很少有人行道，也没有坡道和栏杆。

sentences.english: The approach ramp is a double deck roadway structure.
sentences.chinese: 该引桥坡道是双层公路桥。

sentences.english: A：Left at the end of the ramp?
Below is a list of some really good free and paid ramp plan resources on the net.
sentences.chinese: 以下是一些非常好的免费和付费计划坡道上的资源网。

sentences.english: First, they started with half-pipe and vert ramp skateboarding.
sentences.chinese: 首先，他们开始使用半管和垂直坡道滑板。

sentences.english: Hot and perspiring, he toiled up the dusty ascent.
sentences.chinese: 他艰难地在尘土飞扬的坡道上爬著，热得汗水淋淋。

sentences.english: Large-scale ramp garage, garden villas and private garage ramp.
sentences.chinese: 大型车库坡道，花园别墅区和私人车库坡道。

sentences.english: Large-scale ramp garage, garden villas and private garage ramp.
sentences.chinese: 大型车库坡道，花园别墅区和私人车库坡道。

sentences.english: You can also jump down from the brown wooden ramp leading away from the Visitor Center.
sentences.chinese: 你也可以从棕色的远离游客中心的木质坡道上跳下来。

definition: uphill/upslope/to move upwards/to climb a slope
to turn/to go around a corner
to go round a curve/to turn a corner/fig. a new direction
to brake (when driving)/to stop/to switch off/to check (bad habits)/a brake
